summary: This is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a potential cooperator at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who claims to have information about Jeffrey Epstein from another inmate. The emails focus on evaluating the quality of the information and whether to pursue a cooperation agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the potential cooperator's information; an inmate at MCC reportedly gave information relating to him.

events.title: Call about aspiring cooperator at MCC
events.description: An AUSA spoke with someone who received a call from an aspiring cooperator at MCC named IM=, who reported that another MCC inmate known as "i" gave him information relating to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email discussion on cooperator info
events.description: AUSAs correspond to discuss the substance of the information from the potential cooperator, including a claim that 'a said he gave Epstein the sheets he used, and to decide whether to extend a cooperation agreement.

keyFacts: An aspiring cooperator at MCC contacted prosecutors claiming another inmate provided him with information about Jeffrey Epstein.
The potential cooperator had been trying to secure a cooperation agreement for months, often with second- or third-hand information.
A key claim from the information was that someone ('a') said he gave Epstein 'the sheets he used', though this was noted as second-hand.
Prosecutors were evaluating the quality of the information and considering whether to offer a formal cooperation agreement.
The correspondence shows active investigation and intelligence gathering regarding Epstein while he was in custody at MCC.
